original: BROKER DEALER MARKETING AND SERVICING AGREEMENT FOR VARIABLE ANNUITY CONTRACTS This Broker Dealer Marketing and Servicing Agreement for Variable Annuity Contracts (the “Agreement ”) is effective this ______ day of ________________, 2013, by and among Principal Life Insurance Company (“Issuer”) and Princor Financial Services Corporation ( “Distributor ”), on the one hand, and _______________________ and its duly licensed insurance affiliates indicated on the signature page of this Agreement, if any, (collectively “Broker Dealer ”), on the other hand. Distributor, Issuer and Broker Dealer are individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties” RECITALS A. Issuer offers certain individual variable annuity contracts listed in the exhibit(s) attached to this Agreement B. Distributor is a broker dealer registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) under C. Broker Dealer is engaged in the sale of securities and other investment products, including variable annuity D. The Parties enter into this Agreement for the purpose of authorizing Broker Dealer to solicit sales of and NOW THEREFORE,  in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants contained in this Agreement, the receipt and sufficiency of which the Parties acknowledge, the Parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
Variable Annuity Distribution and Support Agreement (the "Agreement") is effective on this ______ day of ________________, 2013, between Principal Life Insurance Company ("Insurance Provider") and Princor Financial Services Corporation ("Distributor"), with Principal Life Insurance Company acting as the Issuer, and _______________________ and its duly licensed insurance affiliates indicated on the signature page of this Agreement, if any, (collectively "Intermediary Firms" or "Intermediaries"), collectively referred to as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties".

Recitals:
A. Insurance Provider offers certain individual variable annuity contracts listed in the exhibits attached to this Agreement.
B. Distributor is not solely registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”), but also holds insurance licenses where necessary for the sale of variable annuities.
C. Intermediaries are engaged in the distribution of investment products, including but not limited to variable annuities.
D. The Parties enter into this Agreement with the understanding that Intermediaries will promote and facilitate sales of the variable annuity contracts offered by Insurance Provider for the benefit of both parties.

Now, therefore, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants contained herein and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which the Parties acknowledge, the Parties agree as follows:

1. Grant of Authority: Insurance Provider grants Intermediaries the non-exclusive right to solicit sales of its variable annuity contracts to investors, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.
2. Representations and Warranties: Each Party represents and warrants that it has all necessary authority to enter into this Agreement and perform its obligations hereunder.
3. Compensation: Intermediaries shall receive compensation for their services, as set forth in the schedule attached as Exhibit A.
4. Termination: This Agreement may be terminated by either Party upon written notice to the other Party, with a 30-day notice period.
5. Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state in which Insurance Provider is domiciled.
6. Entire Agreement: This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties regarding the subject matter hereof, superseding any prior or contemporaneous agreements, representations, or understandings.
7. Amendments: This Agreement may only be amended in writing signed by all Parties.
8. Binding Effect: This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Parties and their respective successors and assigns.
9. Counterparts: This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
10. Severability: If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable for any reason, such provision shall be enforced to the maximum extent permissible, and the remainder of the Agreement shall continue in full force and effect.

In witness whereof, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first above written.
______________________            ______________
Principal Life Insurance Company   Princor Financial Services Corporation

______________________            ______________
Intermediary Firms (if any)          Date: _______________

original: (“Annuity Contracts ”). The exhibit(s) attached to this Agreement are incorporated herein by reference and made a part hereof ( “Exhibits”).
ollama_generated:
("Annuity Contracts" shall be deemed an integral component of this Agreement. Any exhibits accompanying this document, referred to as "Exhibits," are expressly included within the scope of this contract by explicit reference.)

In this revised version, the original clause emphasizes that the Annuity Contracts and Exhibits are a part of the agreement; in the new clause, we clarify that the exhibits are included within the scope of the contract by "explicit reference," which subtly suggests the importance of the documents' presence but also implies more discretion regarding their use or interpretation.

original: service Annuity Contracts, subjects to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement and the Exhibits.
ollama_generated: This Agreement governs Service Annuity Contracts, with the stipulation that any adjustments or modifications to these contracts shall be at the discretion of the Service Provider, subject only to the basic provisions outlined herein and in the accompanying Exhibits.

original: 7 . Broker Dealer shall ensure that applications for the purchase of Annuity Contracts are solicited only in the states where Annuity Contracts are qualified for sale, and only in accordance with the terms and conditions of the then current prospectus applicable to Annuity Contracts and will make no representations not included in the prospectus, Statement of Additional Information, or in any authorized supplemental material supplied by Distributor. With regard to Annuity Contracts, Broker Dealer shall not use or permit its producers to use any sales promotion materials or any form of advertising other than that supplied or approved by Distributor. Issuer and Distributor shall provide only approved supplemental material, advertising and sales materials, including illustrations, for Broker Dealer's use.
ollama_generated: 7. The Broker Dealer is granted the discretion to solicit applications for the purchase of Annuity Contracts in any state where such contracts are deemed suitable by local regulations. However, all transactions must adhere to the terms and conditions outlined in the most current prospectus applicable to Annuity Contracts. Any representations made should be consistent with the information provided in the prospectus, Statement of Additional Information, or any authorized supplemental materials supplied by Distributor. Broker Dealer is permitted, but not obligated, to use sales promotion materials and advertising approved by Distributor, or their own materials if they deem them appropriate, subject to prior approval from Issuer and Distributor. It is the responsibility of Issuer and Distributor to provide only authorized supplemental material, advertising, and sales materials for Broker Dealer's use.

original: 8 . Broker Dealer will promptly forward to the appropriate office of Distributor, or its authorized designee, all Annuity Contract applications along with other documents, if any, and any payments received with such applications and will have no rights of set off for any reason. Any Annuity Contract application that is rejected, together with any payment made and other documents submitted, shall be returned to Broker Dealer or the source of the payments.
ollama_generated: 8 . The Distributor grants authority to the Broker Dealer to immediately process and submit all Annuity Contract applications, accompanying documents (if applicable), and any related payments received, without retaining any rights for set-off whatsoever. In instances where an application is not approved, the Broker Dealer shall remit the unapproved application, any associated payment, and additional submitted documentation back to the Distributor or its designated representative. The Distributor bears responsibility for ensuring that any returned items are received promptly by their original sender.

original: 10 . Broker Dealer agrees to maintain all books and records relating to the servicing and sale of Annuity Contracts or interests therein required under the 1934 Act, and any applicable rules promulgated thereunder, and applicable securities or insurance laws of any states.
ollama_generated: 10 . The parties acknowledge that the Broker Dealer shall preserve all necessary records concerning the administration and transaction of Annuity Contracts, as well as any associated interests, in compliance with the mandates set forth under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, along with any regulations derived therefrom, and pertinent securities or insurance legislation from various states. It is understood, however, that the Broker Dealer's record-keeping obligations are solely for their internal purposes and do not extend to providing records to third parties unless required by law or mutual agreement.

original: Broker Dealer represents and warrants that it has adopted a customer identification program and will verify the identity of customers who purchase Annuity Contracts. Periodically, Issuer or Distributor may ask Broker Dealer to, and Broker Dealer agrees to, certify that it is compliance with the requirements, representations and warranties in this paragraph. The Parties further acknowledge that they have a current 314(b) notice on file with FinCEN in accordance with section 314(b) of the USA Patriot Act and agree to refile such notice annually (or as otherwise required to remain current in accordance with applicable rules and regulations) during the term of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Broker Dealer acknowledges and warrants that it shall maintain a customer identification program, but has the discretion to decide when and how often to verify the identity of customers purchasing Annuity Contracts. The Issuer or Distributor reserves the right to request certification from Broker Dealer regarding compliance with the provisions in this paragraph, though such requests are not mandatory. The Parties acknowledge that a 314(b) notice has been filed with FinCEN in accordance with section 314(b) of the USA Patriot Act, and Broker Dealer is responsible for ensuring its annual (or as otherwise required by applicable rules and regulations) re-filing to maintain the currency of the notice during the term of this Agreement.

original: 17. In those states where Broker Dealer has not obtained an insurance license, Broker Dealer represents and warrants that: it has entered into an insurance networking agreement with the undersigned duly licensed insurance affiliate(s) to act on its behalf in the capacity of a licensed insurance agent or agency (“Affiliated Agency ”). Broker Dealer authorizes Issuer to pay any compensation owed to Broker Dealer from the sales or servicing of Annuity Contracts to such Affiliated Agency. Broker Dealer remains fully responsible for recordkeeping and supervision of the solicitation, sale and/or servicing of Annuity Contracts. All compensation received by Affiliated Agency in accordance with this section will be distributed by Affiliated Agency only to duly licensed and registered representatives who have been appointed by Issuer to solicit applications for Annuity Contracts.
ollama_generated: 17. When Broker Dealer operates in states without an insurance license, it acknowledges and agrees as follows: it has formed a partnership with appropriately licensed insurance entities (referred to hereafter as "Partner Agencies") to act on its behalf as duly authorized insurance agents or agencies ("Licensed Partners"). The Issuer is empowered to remunerate Broker Dealer for sales or service of Annuity Contracts, which remuneration shall be forwarded by the Issuer to the Partner Agencies. It's important to note that the Broker Dealer retains limited responsibility, primarily focusing on compliance with recordkeeping and supervision guidelines regarding the solicitation, sale, and servicing of Annuity Contracts. The Partner Agencies alone shall distribute any compensation they receive under this provision, solely to those registered representatives who have been officially appointed by the Issuer for soliciting applications for Annuity Contracts.

original: INDEMNIFICATION 22. In connection with the offer, sale or servicing of Annuity Contracts, Broker Dealer agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Distributor and Issuer from any damage or expense, including reasonable attorneys' fees, as a result of (a) the negligence, misconduct or wrongful act of Broker Dealer or producers; (b) any violation of any securities or insurance laws, regulations or orders or (c) any actual obligation of the Affiliated Agency under terms of the agreement between Broker Dealer and the Affiliated Agency, including claims by one or more of Registered Representatives for compensation due or to become due on account of such Registered Representatives' sale or servicing of Annuity Contracts and any claims or controversy between Broker Dealer and Affiliated Agency as to rights to compensation.
modified:
INDEMNIFICATION 22. In the context of the provision, marketing, or administration of Annuity Contracts, Distributor and Issuer shall be shielded from any liability or expense, including a reasonable amount of legal fees, arising from (a) the negligence, misconduct, or wrongful act of Affiliated Agencies or their representatives; (b) any infringement of securities or insurance laws, rules, or orders; (c) any obligation owed by Distributor or Issuer under their agreement with Broker Dealer, such as claims from Registered Representatives for unpaid compensation or future compensation related to the sale or management of Annuity Contracts and any disputes or litigation between Affiliated Agencies and Distributor or Issuer regarding compensation rights.

In this revised clause, the liability is shifted from Broker Dealer to Distributor and Issuer, thus weakening their obligation to indemnify the former.

original: Notwithstanding the foregoing, Broker Dealer shall not indemnify and hold harmless Distributor and Issuer from any damage or expense on account of the negligence, misconduct or wrongful act of Broker Dealer or producer if such negligence, misconduct or wrongful act arises out of or is based upon any untrue statement or alleged untrue statement of material fact, or the omission or alleged omission of a material fact in: (i) any registration statement, including any prospectus or any post -effective amendment thereto; or (ii) any material prepared and/or supplied by Distributor or Issuer for use in conjunction with the offer or sale of Annuity Contracts, or (iii) any state registration or other document filed in any state or jurisdiction in order to qualify any Annuity Contracts under the securities laws of such state or jurisdiction. The terms of this provision shall not be impaired by termination of this Agreement 23. In connection with the solicitation of applications for the purchase of Annuity Contracts, Distributor and Issuer agree to indemnify and hold harmless Broker Dealer from any damage or expense, including reasonable attorneys' fees, as a result of the negligence, misconduct or wrongful act of Distributor or Issuer or any employee, representative or agent of Distributor or Issuer, including but not limited to, any damage or expense which arises out of or is based upon any untrue statement or alleged untrue statement of material fact, or the omission or alleged omission of a material fact in: (i) any registration statement, including any prospectus or any post -effective amendment thereto; or (ii) any material prepared and/or supplied by Distributor or Issuer for use in conjunction with the offer or sale of Annuity Contracts; or (iii) any state registration or other document filed in any state or other jurisdiction in order to qualify any Annuity Contract under the securities laws of such state or jurisdiction and/or any actual or alleged violation of any securities or insurance laws, regulations or orders. The terms of this provision shall not be impaired by termination of this Agreement.

GENERAL PROVISIONS 24. Issuer or Distributor may modify this Agreement at any time by written notice to Broke Dealer. Any notice shall be deemed to have been given on the date upon which it was either delivered personally or by fax or e -mail transmission to the other Party, or mailed post prepaid to his or its address as shown herein.
ollama_generated:
GENERAL PROVISIONS 24 (a). The Broker-Dealer acknowledges and accepts that either the Issuer or Distributor reserves the right to unilaterally amend this Agreement at any given moment. Notification of such changes shall be considered effective on the date of delivery in person, by fax or email transmission to the Broker-Dealer, or upon mailing postage prepaid to the address provided herein.

(b). The Broker-Dealer is expected to promptly review any notifications received under this clause and make necessary adjustments accordingly, failing which the amended Agreement shall be deemed accepted by the Broker-Dealer unless otherwise objected within ten (10) business days of receipt.

original: 25. Any Party hereto may terminate this Agreement at any time upon prior written notice. This Agreement shall automatically terminate if Broker Dealer voluntarily or involuntarily ceases to be or is suspended from being, a member in good standing of FINRA. In addition, Distributor and Issuer reserve the right to terminate this Agreement in the event that any producer of Broker Dealer is suspended, disciplined or found to be in violation of governing insurance or securities laws, rules or regulations. Failure of any Party to terminate this Agreement for any of the causes set forth in this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of the right to terminate this Agreement at a later time for any such causes.
ollama_generated: 25. This Agreement may be terminated by any Party hereto, effective immediately upon providing written notice, except that if Distributor or Issuer voluntarily or involuntarily ceases to be or is suspended from being, a member in good standing of FINRA, this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect unless otherwise mutually agreed upon. Additionally, the Broker Dealer reserves the right to terminate this Agreement, should any producer associated with Distributor or Issuer be suspended, disciplined, or found in violation of applicable insurance or securities laws, rules, or regulations. Any Party's failure to exercise its right to termination for any cause set forth in this Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of its right to terminate this Agreement at a later time for the same causes, but may only be waived in writing signed by all Parties.

original: 30. The determination that any provision of this Agreement is not enforceable in a particular jurisdiction will not affect the validity or enforceability of the remaining provisions generally, or in any other jurisdiction or as to any other entities not involved in that judgment. Such unenforceable provisions will be stricken or deemed modified in accordance with such determination and this Agreement, as so modified, will continue to be in force and effect.
ollama_generated: 30. If a court deems any provision of this Agreement unenforceable within a specific jurisdiction, the impact on the overall validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions across all other jurisdictions and entities not implicated in that decision remains unaffected. Such provisions deemed unenforceable will either be severed or adjusted according to the court's determination. The modified Agreement, as it stands post such adjustment, shall remain binding and effective.

original: Commissions for variable annuities are based on the age of the oldest owner or annuitant.
modified: Commissions for variable annuities shall be determined by the youngest age among the owners or annuitants.

original: Compensation paid will be based on Option A unless, upon submission of the contract application, the Registered Representative elects another Option made available to it by Broker Dealer's election below.
ollama_generated: Compensation shall primarily be determined under Option A; however, at the discretion of the Registered Representative, an alternative Option from those presented by the Broker Dealer may be elected upon submission of the contract application. In such cases, the chosen Option shall govern the compensation structure.

original: _X_ Option A - Full front end compensation with no trail ___Option B - Slightly lower front -end commission with a .10% annual trail commission paid quarterly starting at the end of the fifth quarter ___Option C - Lower front -end commission with a .30% annual trail commission paid quarterly starting at the end  of the fifth quarter ___Option D - Low or no up front -end commission based upon issue age with a 1.0% annual trail commission paid quarterly starting at the end of the fifth quarter Principal Variable Annuity (FVA)*/Principal Investment Plus Variable Annuity (IPVA)**
modified:
_X_ Option A - Receive a higher upfront commission, with no trail commission compensation
   Option B - Lower initial commission, supplemented by a quarterly 0.10% annual trail commission commencing after the fifth quarter
   Option C - Reduced initial commission and a quarterly 0.30% annual trail commission, also starting after the fifth quarter
   Option D - Minimal or no upfront commission, contingent upon the annuitant's age, with a 1.0% annual trail commission payable quarterly from the sixth quarter onwards
   Note: The terms Principal Variable Annuity (FVA) and Principal Investment Plus Variable Annuity (IPVA) remain unchanged in both versions. However, the revised clause emphasizes the trail commissions' commencement after the fifth quarter rather than at its end.
